summary: Clean implementation of POST /pages/ API endpoint that follows existing codebase patterns. The code properly handles page creation, updates, and deletion with appropriate validation and authorization checks. A few unused imports exist but the core functionality is solid and ready to merge.

issues.description: Unused imports: Q and Value are imported but never used in the file
issues.suggestion: Remove unused imports: change 'from django.db.models import Exists, OuterRef, Q, Value' to 'from django.db.models import Exists, OuterRef'

issues.description: Unused import: Coalesce is imported but never used
issues.suggestion: Remove the line 'from django.db.models.functions import Coalesce'

issues.description: Magic number 20 for admin role could be more readable
issues.suggestion: This matches existing codebase patterns (used in module.py, issue.py, cycle.py, etc.), so keeping for consistency is acceptable

positives: Proper authentication and authorization using ProjectEntityPermission
Correct validation flow: checks page_view enabled, locked status, and ownership before modifications
Good use of select_related/prefetch_related for query optimization
Follows established patterns for webhook activity tracking
DELETE correctly requires archived_at check before deletion
Clean separation between create and response serializers
Proper handling of parent-child relationships on deletion
